Package it.polimi.ingswPSP35.server.controller

Class DivinityMediatorDecorator

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingswPSP35.server.controller.DivinityMediator
it.polimi.ingswPSP35.server.controller.DivinityMediatorDecorator
Direct Known Subclasses:
SentinelDecorator
public abstract class DivinityMediatorDecorator
extends DivinityMediator
The presence of divinities that affect other players' turns requires a way for Divinities to be "consulted" outside of their turn. This is achieved through the use of mediator pattern combined with decorator pattern (see DivinityMediator for more details).

Because a 3 player game can become a 2 player game, it's important to be able to modify decorations at runtime, in case the Divinity eliminated has decorated the mediator. This is through the removeMediator method.

Please note that all implementations of this class are inner classes of the respective divinity (Athena, Hera and Limus)

Author:
Paolo Galli
See Also:
DivinityMediator

  • Field Details

    • decoratedMediator

      protected DivinityMediator decoratedMediator
      Reference to the mediator this Decorator is decorating. This serves the same purpose of a NEXT pointer in a singly-linked list, as it allows the mediator to change at runtime.

  • Constructor Details

    • DivinityMediatorDecorator

      public DivinityMediatorDecorator​(DivinityMediator toDecorate)
      Sole constructor for this class. It's akin to an insertion at the front of a singly-linked list.
      Parameters:
      toDecorate - DivinityMediator to be decorated by this class

      public boolean checkMove​(Worker workerToBeMoved, Square workerSquare, Square destination)
      Description copied from class: DivinityMediator
      Method called before any divinity performs a move action to check if the move is allowed by all divinities.
      Overrides:

      Parameters:
      workerToBeMoved - Worker the caller is attempting to move

    • checkWin

      public boolean checkWin​(Worker worker, Square workerSquare, Square destination)
      Description copied from class: DivinityMediator
      Method called before any divinity declares itself the winner to check if the action is allowed by all divinities. Because all divinities with additional win conditions either move (Pan) or are not affected by other divinities (Chronus), this method will only (and always) be called after a move action; hence the need for the "origin" parameter, as the move has already happened and this class can't and shouldn't be able to obtain the previous state of the game (in this case, the worker's position before calling this method).
      Overrides:
      checkWin in class DivinityMediator
      Parameters:
      worker - Worker that has potentially won the game
      workerSquare - Square containing the worker that has potentially won the game
      destination - Square that contained the worker before moving and calling this method
      Returns:
      true if the worker has won, false otherwise

    • getName

      public abstract java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the name of the Divinity this Decorator belongs to. It's used to identify Decorators during their removal at runtime.
      Returns:
      the name of the Divinity this Decorator belongs to

    • getDecoratedMediator

      public DivinityMediator getDecoratedMediator()
      Getter for decoratedMediator parameter. It's used for removal of decorators.
      Returns:
      decoratedMediator parameter

    • removeDecorator

      public void removeDecorator​(java.lang.String toRemove)
      Removes the DivinityMediatorDecorator identified by the String toRemove. If no such Decorator exists, this method has no side effects.
      Parameters:
      toRemove - String corresponding to the Decorator to be removed
